title: "The Power of Visualization and Memory Techniques"
first_phrase: This section explores the power of visualization and memory in shaping our minds and impacting those around us. It traces the origins of visualization to ancient concepts of imagination and impression, and highlights the importance of cultivating our ability to visualize in specific and vivid ways. The section also delves into the art of memory, a method of harnessing the imagination to improve our ability to remember and recall information. The author cites Virgilio T.'s advice to observe illuminated images and then close one's eyes to remember them exactly, leveraging the reflective light to enhance memory retention. Practical tips for improving visualization, such as shining a bright light on the image or symbol, are also provided.
content: L’”Ars Memoriae” ha estado siempre cultivada como método de reconducir la imaginación bajo el dominio de la voluntad. La memoria consiste en efecto en el “fijar el mercurio”, es decir normalmente libre y vaga en el hombre. In términos alquímicos el principio pasivo (=A) viene fijado del principio activo (=D) relacionado a la memoria y a la atención[202]. Nuestro maestro Virgilio T. nos aconsejaba de observar imágenes iluminadas, con “un reflejo”, luego cerrar los ojos y recordarlas EXACTAMENTE. La luz refleja mejora en efecto la memoria nostro maestro Virgilio T., ci consigliava di osservare immagini illuminate, con “un riflesso”, poi chiudere gli occhi e ricordarla ESATTAMENTE. La luce riflessa migliora infatti la memoria retentiva y potencia la mente. En práctica haga caer una luz fuerte sobre la imagen que quiere fijar. En muchas tradiciones existe justamente el hábito de colocar fuentes luminosas cercanas a símbolos importantes. Importante. No son sin embargo solo los auxilios técnicos que deberán el resultado final.
last_phrase: In summary, to improve our memory and imagination, we can use the "Ars Memoriae" technique that involves using illuminated images to fix our attention and recall them precisely. Placing a strong light source near important symbols can help, but ultimately, it is an art that requires us to make peace with our subconscious and primal selves. By merging imagination and memory, we can enrich our intelligence and deepen our understanding of the world around us.
